_comment: Created by rreed on 4/19/2017 4:37:28 PM using v2.7
title: How has the number of managerial staff in the NHS changed over time?
analysis_commentary:
Contrary to popular belief, between September 2009 and October 2016, there has been a substantial decrease in the number of managers (19% decrease) and senior managers (16% decrease) employed in the English NHS. In September 2009 there were 11,892 senior managers and 25,687 managers, which have dropped to 9,785and 20,946 respectively in October 2016.

Updated January 2017.
